journal_entry: The wind N. West heavy blow. made small chair and worked in shop
The wind Easterly and snow storm put wood in shed
The wind W. N. W. went on board the Sea Flower and pumped her out.

The wind very moderate Westerly got two Bbls coal home and went on the shore and Married Mr Henry Bunker and Miss Hattie Bunker both of Gouldsboro came back and went to Hall meeting and was chosen secretary
The wind North East wrote letter to the Secretary of Narraguagus Lodge got the Sea Flower underway and went to South West Harbor and landed freight hauled away from wharf at dark.
location: Winter Harbor, Southwest Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Northerly in morning very moderate. got under way at day light and went to Crandberry Isles put the Sea Flower at Thomas Bunker's wharf in the pool. and settled with him for the Sea Flower's summers' work paid him $23.12 ballance do him. Got in dora and started for home at 11 A.M. rowed as far as Otter Creek. got on boards of Schr Halcyon and got home at 3 oclock P.M. with the wind mor westerly
location: Winter Harbor, Cranberry Isles , Otter Creek, Winter Harbor
notes: changed Bunkers to Bunker's, changed Flowers to Flower's, changed summers to summer's

journal_entry: The wind North East very moderate all day with snow wrote letters to Hancock Co Pub Co and Thomas Bunker work in shop.
letter_to: Hancock Company Pub Company, Thomas Bunker

journal_entry: The wind N.N.W. settled with Capt Abner Tracy. For the Schr Signal

The wind N. East in morning snowing S.S.E. in afternoon settled account with Capt Thomas Hammond Schr Amulet. wrote letters to Sec of Continental Life Ins Co. Hartford David Tyler Deer Isle. and J. A. Pilsbury of Bucksport W. H. Pilsbury
letter_to: Continental Life Insurance Company, David Tyler, J. A. Pilsbury, W. H. Pilsbury

journal_entry: The wind Westerly heavy breeze and cold
The wind Westerly moderate wrote letter to Benj. Kittridge work in shop
The wind North W. wrote ltter to Capt Thomas Smallidge work in shop
The wind Easterly snow in afternoon work in shop
The wind North W. cold and blowing work in shop turning
The wind North West cold and blowy issued warrant for Hall meeting to be called Jan 22
The wind North West work in shop
The wind North West
The wind N West made Axe handle getting ready to go in woods
The wind Northerly went up stream to work in woods, cutting firewood came out at night.
The wind Northerly and very cold went back into the woods. stand at staid at camp all night
The wind Northerly and cold cut wood all day came out at night recd letter from Benj. Kitttridge
The wind Easterly and snowy. work in shop. Went to Hall meeting in evening called by warrant
The wind N.N. W. cold and blustering work turning in shop.
The wind Easterly. very moderate snow and rain in evening
The wind Westerly commenced making pullies for circular saw table
The wind North West work in shop recd letter from Benj. Kittridge wrote letter to W. B. McCrate.
The wind N. N. W.  very cold and blowy commenced making ballance wheel for Circular table
The wind westerly moderate wrote letters to Benj Kittridge and Aiken and Co Sent Signals bills to Aiken and Co. Ellsworth
notes: changed Kittredge to Kittridge, changed & to and, changed & to and, changes & to and

journal_entry: The wind North East moderate rain work in shop on ballance wheel made canvass belt in evening
very moderate wind Northerly turning Iron for shafts for saw
The wind very moderate light rain South East and warm. went up the shore in afternoon and married John Myrick and Olive Hammond both of Gouldsboro.
The wind Northerly Snowy in forenoon acknowledged deed for Thomas Hammond work in shop on saw table
The wind very moderate to the westward recd Postal card from W. B. McCrate
The wind Southerly rainy in afternoon work in shop on saw table
The wind Westerly good breeze finished saw table recd letter from Benj. Kittridge
The wind Westerly went in the woods cutting firewood
The wind Westerly work in shop wrote letter to H. D. Coombs and recd letter from H. D. Coombs
The wind Northerly
The wind N. N. E verry cold and snowy work in shop set up all night with Geo. Gerrish
The wind Northerly wrote letters to Ellsworth American Benj. Kittridge and sent Papers of Amulets and Signal to Benj Kittridge also a statement of the Amulets account for the year ending 1874
The wind North West work in woods cutting wood
The wind S.S.East snowy commenced making wheel for Black Warrior
The wind W.N.W work in shop making wheel set up with Geo. Gerrish all night
The wind Northerly went in the woods
The wind Northerly and cold.
The wind North West and very cold work in shop
The wind North West went in the woods. James Stevens Girl died at 6 P.M.
Calm in morning and pleasant snow in afternoon the wind Westerly at night. work in R. Rands house helping J. F. Kingsley make caskey for Daisy Stevens.
The wind North West moderate work in shop got Foster Jones oxen took them home to haul wood
very moderate and nearly calm all day went in the woods and hauled home two loads of wood
The wind Easterly and snowy in morning rain in afternoon hauled two loads of wood
The wind Westerly good breeze but moderate weather
The wind Southerly and warm. Helping J. F. Kingsley haul cedar home for fencing from Henry Sargent's shore
The wind very moderate South West and very warm snow melts fast.  wrote letter to Thomas Bunker recd one from Benj. Kittridge. work in shop
The wind South Easterly and rainy work in shop. Finished the Black Warior's wheel wrote letter to Benj. Kittridge.
notes: changed Warriors to Warrior's, changed Kittredge to Kittridge

journal_entry: The wind S. E. raining work in shop
The wind West N W work turning desk legs wheel hub etc.
The wind Westerly in foren oon Southerly in afternoon snow in evening
The wind North West good breeze. snow squalls in morning
The wind North West cold. work in shop commenced building a dora.
The wind North East snow in fore noon and clear in afternoon work in shop on dora recd letter from Capt Thomas Bunker and Caroline Blaisdell.
The wind Northerly and pleasant. work in shop on dora
The wind Easterly and big snow storm work in shop on dora.
The wind Easterly and clear Finished building dora.
The wind Easterly and pleasant. wrote letter to Caroline Blaisdell. work in shop
The wind Easterly and warm.
The wind North East painted dora and work in shop
Calm in morning wrote letter to Thomas Bunker work in the fore noon on the Harps cabbin In the afternoon the wind South East painted inside of dora in shop
The wind South East with snow. in morning turned pump box for Schr Lebanon
The wind South East commenced to repair Wind mill
The wind very moderate to the Southward finished work on wind mill. and got ready to go gunning
The wind Northerly went gunning to Turtle Isle Ledges in fore noon. Went to District meeting in afternoon
location: Winter Harbor, Turtle Island Ledges, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and very pleasant
The wind Easterly and misty. took the new dora out the shop and took her to the shore Wrote letter to Benj. Kittridge
The wind Easterly and rainy commenced repairing E. Grover's dora
The wind Westerly finished repairing E. Grover's dora traded guns with T. R. Hammond.
The wind W. N. W. very heavy blow run wind mill turning belaying pins etc. Recd letter from Capt Thomas Bunker
The wind W. N. W. heavy blow jobbing in shop
The wind N. N. W. started for Cranbery Isles in Mary L. Newton took the wind N. E. with snow and went into North East Harbor and went on to Bear Island and staid all night
location: Winter Harbor,  Northeast Harbor, Bear Island

journal_entry: The wind from North to West left Bear Island in the afternoon and went to Cranberry Island
The wind Northerly in forenoon and varyable in afternoon sold the Schr Sea Flower to Capt Thomas Bunker. Started in the after noon for home in dora got home at 5 P.M. moderate all day
The wind N. N. East wrote letters to Secreraty of Treasury in the afternoon the wind out Southerly worked on the Harp recd letter from Benj. Kittridge
The wind Southerly went to Ellsworth with C. Stevens to get a copy of The acct of J. Moore. and B. Rand. Settled with Walter McCrate for wood

one foot of snow fell The wind East in the morning and hauled to the North and West big snow storm all day and heavy blow Examined the acct of Joseph Moore in the forenoon And worked cutting scuttle through closet floor for trap door and cellar stairs in afternoon -biggest snowstorm for the Winter
notes: changed & to and, changed & to and

journal_entry: The wind Westerly work on board the Schr Harp a part of the forenoon. finished cellar stairs and scuttle door in the afternoon and the wind hauled out Southerly in the afternoon roads blocked up

The wind Westerly in forenoon work on board the Harp The wind Southerly in afternoon hauled the Harp from the wharf and went into Sargent's Cove. Recd letter from Geo. A. Dyer. also one from Benj. Kittridge to give the Amulet up
location: Winter Harbor, Sargent Cove, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind North West all day.
The wind Westerly commenced work for J. M. Sargent. on Schr Henrietta to build cabin. The wind Southerly. in the afternoon.
The wind Westerly in forenoon work on Henriettas cabbin and gangway Southerly wind in afternoon wrote letter to C. C. Burrill
The wind North East and pleasant work on Henrietta The wind hauled to the Southrward in afternoon.
The wind Southerly work for J. M. Sargent on Schr Henrietta wrote letter to Benj. Kittidge.

The wind Southerly. and foggy in fore noon sun out in afternoon snow melt very fast. made upper pump box for Schr Lebanon work for J. M. Sargent in afternoon and finished work for him on vessel recd letter from Benj. Kittridge

The wind Southerly snow melts fast wrote lettters to Benj. Kittridge. Benj. Sowle and to the Penobscot fire Ins. Co. put dunnage on board of Schr Harp to go away rain in afternoon. Left Lodge of Good Templars
letter_to: Benjamin Kittridge, Benjamin T. Sowle, Penobscot Fire Insurance Company

journal_entry: The wind North East. very moderate. with rain
The wind North East rainy all day untill about sunset. the wind hauling to the North. wrote letters to Thomas Bunker Register of Probate Caroline Blaisdell and Saml. Libby
letter_to: Thomas Bunker, Register of Probate, Caroline Blaisdell, Samuel Libby

journal_entry: The wind North good breeze my wages commenced on board Schr Harp With Capt Nathan Bickford loosed sails. to dry etc. Recd letters from Benj. Kittridge and Penobscot Mutual Fire Ins Co
letter_from: Benjamin Kittridge, Penobscot Fire Insurance Company
notes: changed &c to etc., changed Kittredge to Kittridge

journal_entry: The wind North West getting ready to go away in vessel

calm in morning wrote letter to Penobscot Ins Co at 9 AM moderate South West Wind left home for Calais kept of by schoodic at 2 PM passed Red Head at dark and Little River light at 12 midnight the wind hauled to the North went into Little River
The wind N. East in morning and hauling out to the Southward. got under way at 2 oclock PM the wind Southwest anchored at West Quaddy at Sun set.
The wind South West fresh breese got underway at noon and went trough Lubec Narrrows for Calais rainy in afternoon by spells anchored at Mill cove at sunset calm.
location: West Quoddy, Lubec Narrrows, Mill Cove

journal_entry: The wind North East in morning and moderate got under way at Mill cove on the turn of the tide about 10 oclock AM the wind hauled to the North beat up above the Devil's Head and anchored at 5 PM below the Ledge
The wind from N. E. to E. N. E. laid at anchor all day on account of ice in river. was finished being cut out to day

The wind N. E. to South. laid at anchor below the Ledge untill 2 oclock very large cakes comming down got underway at 2 PM. sailed through the drift ice and went up to the wharf in Calais wrote letter home
The wind N. East laid along side of the wharf waiting for lumber and working on vessel clear wheather
Calm in morning The wind breezed up Easterly in morning then Southerly. commenced leading the Harp out of rafts of lumber deal for New York
The wind Easterly nearly filled the hold with deal
The wind Easterly and rainy did not work loading
The wind N. W. very pleasant untill evening then snowed
The wind North West and cold filled the hold put in the ports and some on deck
The wind North West very cold ice made all day and snow all day. work loading and cutting ice of lumber recd letter from home.
Calm in morning thick with snow the wind breezed up N. N. West loading from a raft
The wind N. N. W. finished loading and got ready to sail towed down the river at 12 oclock midnight
The wind North West in fore noon abrest of Eastport at sunrise and abest of Little River at 12 P.M. then took the wind W. S. W. abrest of Moose Peak at dark
location: Calais, Eastport, Little River, Moose Peak

journal_entry: Calm in morning Petit menan bore N. W. by W. at 8 oclock AM. about 5 miles distant the wind breezed up southerly went in home and anchored a few minutes before sun set.

The wind North West got under way in the morning for New York. went up inside as far as Deer Isle and kept of by Saddle back and went outside of Matinicus Rock passed matinicus Rock at dark pleasant weather wind increasing. at 8 PM took in outer jib and stowed it also fore and main gaft top sails steered W. S. W.
location: Winter Harbor, Deer Isle, Saddleback Island, Matinicus Rock

journal_entry: The wind North West at one AM. took in flying jib and stowed it. at 3 AM more moderate set flying jib at 7 bells. the wind hauled more Westerly set fore and main gaft topsails and outer jib kept of for Cape Cod. at noon Lat by dead reckoning 42.53 by observation 42.48 at sun set saw Cape Cod and spoke the Schr Sarah A. Reed of Calais. at 12 oclock midnight abreast of Naucet lights with a fine breeze North West.

The wind moderate North West passed the Polock Rip at 5. AM at 10. Am calm and anchored between the Handkerchief and cross rip Light Ships. at one the wind breezed up S. W. by S. got under way and anchored in Tarpaulin Cove at 6 oclock in the afternoon wrote a letter home
location: Polock Rip, Handkerchief, Cross Rip Shoal, Tarpaulin Cove

journal_entry: The wind moderate to the Eastward got underway in Tarpaulin Cove at 6 oclock in the morning the wind breezing passed Point Judith at one oclock in the afternoon fresh breeze passed Little Gull Light at 5 P.M. and New Haven at 12 midnight
location: Tarpaulin Cove, Point Judith, Little Gull Island Light, New Haven

journal_entry: The wind Easterly passed Eaton's Neck at 5 AM moderate passed between Sand Point and Execution Rock Light at 12 M anchored untill the turn of the ride then towed through the gate and anchored in New York at dark.
location: New Haven, Sandy Point, Execution Rocks Light, New York

journal_entry: The wind W. N. W. fresh breeze waiting for a berth to discharge towed into Jersey City at sunset to dischage
The wind Easterly discharged deck load. rain squalls in the Evening
The wind Westerly and blowed very heavy. wrote letter home
The wind Westerly heavy breeze work discharging hold full
The wind Easterly Rainy in forenoon did not work. In the Afternoon held up raining and finished on loading and hauled away from the wharf at night and went to Wehawken to load with coal.
The wind South West pleasant loosed sails set up rigging put in lumber parts and cleared up the deck and hold.
The wind Easterly and rainy caulked the lumber ports and waited for a berth at the wharf to load.
The wind Northerly waiting for a berth and working on vessel. hauled into the dock at night.
Moderate rainstorm in forenoon wind Easterly cleared up at 10 oclock Am. and loaded with stove and Egg coal for Boston. Wrote letter home

Calm and warm hauled from the Dock in forenoon took a lug boat and towed through Hell gate at noon and anchored. got underway again at 3 P.M. with a light wind to the Southward. passed Execution Rock and Sand point Lights at sunset. anchored at Hempstead at 10 PM calm and thick of fog.
location: Weehawken, Hell Gate, Execution Rocks Light, Sand Point Light, Hempstead

journal_entry: Very moderate to the Eastward in morning got underway on the Ebb tide. and the wind breezed up to the Westward good breeze at 12 oclock M. passed Statford Light ship rainy in afternoon rim winged out passed Falkner's Island at 4 P.M. passed Cornfield light ship at sunset and the Little Gull at 11 PM moderate
location: Hempstead, Stratford Shoal Light, Falkner Island, Cornfield Point Lightship, Little Gull Island Light
notes: assumed W for Eastward am, assumed E for Westward pm

journal_entry: The wind Westerly an old sea running in Block Island Channel at 9 AM point Judith bore North. Two miles distant the wind hauled S. W. by W. passed Vineyard Haven at 5 P.M. the wind hauled out S. W. and breezed up. passed Cross rip Light Ship at 7 1/2 oclock. passed the Handkerchief Light ship at 9 1/2 oclock. and the Pollock rip at 11. PM. good weather
location: Block Island, Point Judith, Vineyard Haven, Cross Rip Shoal, Handkerchief, Pollock Rip

journal_entry: The wind S. S. W. abrest of Naucet Lights at 4 AM passed Cape Cod light 7 1/2 oclock Minots Rock at noon blowing very heavy tore foresail and Jib got in Boston about 2 oclock let go both anchors
location: Nauset Light, Highland Light, Minots Light, Boston

journal_entry: The wind westerly and pleasant set up rigging and mending sails towed into the wharf in Charlestown to discharge coal wrote letter home recd one from home
The wind Southerly and Easterly stevedores dicharging coal the crew to work on sails
The wind Easterly and foggy. got discharged at 3. oclock P.M. bent foresail and got ready for sea hauled through the bridge. at dark.
The wind North W. left Boston for Winter Harbor in the morning. Passed Thatcher's Island at noon at 12 oclock night Monhegan bore N. E. about 5 miles distant
The wind W. N. W. passed matinicus Rock at 4 A.M. The wind hauled out S.W. passed Baker's Island at noon. the wind hauled to the North bear into Winter Harbor anchored at 4 PM
location: Matinicus Rock, Bakers Island, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Easterly and pleasant. getting ready to do some farming
The wind Easterly and misty help J. F. Kingsley. in forenoon and plowing for myself in afternoon
The wind Southerly in the afternoon showery planted potatoes and sowed oats
The wind W. N. W. got underway for Calais in forenoon heavy sea running The wind hauled more Westerly passed Little River at 9 P.M. anchored at West Quaddy at 12 at night
location: Winter Harbor, Little River, West Quoddy

journal_entry: The wind Southerly got underway in the forenoon anchored at the Ledge at 3 PM got underway again and anchored above the Ledge wind Baffling
The wind Noth West good breeze but pleasant laid at anchor all day
The wind North W. work on vessel in forenoon and towed to Calais in afternoon. on bent the old foresail and got ready to commence loading. wrote letter home
The wind very moderate and variable. and hot commenced loading apart out of the water and a part off the wharf. the wind came of at night with a squall with Thunder and heavy rain.
The wind Westerly loading with lumber
The wind Southerly and Westerly work on vessel in forenoon and loading in the afternoon.
The wind blowing down river work loading filled the hold at noon and commenced pulling the deck load on.
The wind Southerly work loading in forenoon and on vessel in afternoon
The wind very moderate blowing up river
The wind Southerly finished loading at night and towed down to the ledge.
The wind Southerly got underway in forenoon and beat down to Perry and anchored at 3. P.M.
The wind very moderate Southerly got underwat and beat down to Welch Pool Campbello
Calm in morning. got underway at 11 oclock Am and passed East Quaddy at 12 M with the wind S.W. by W and beat up the shore
The wind S. W. moosepeak light bore W.S.W. 4 miles dis at sunrise. got in home at sunset
The wind Southerly and foggy in morning cleared up at 7 went gunning
The wind Southerly and foggy and in the afternoon rainy.
The wind E.N.E. came out of home in forenoon passed Long Island at 5 P.M. moderate rain storm and foggy sighted Matinicus Rock Lights at 9 P.M. bearing N.W. the wind hauled to the North East
location: Winter Harbor, Long Island, Matinicus Rock

journal_entry: Very moderate wind to the Westward and pleasant (calculations). The wind S. by W. in the afternoon
notes: assumed E for Westward am, unsure about latitude and longitude for this date, see 013.png image for calculations

journal_entry: The wind S. E. by E. and overcast the wind hauled Easterly and rain no observation Sighted Cape Cod at 2 P.M. and passed the Light house at 4 P.M. and run for the Pollock Ripp could not make it tacked and headed N.N.E. at 8 oclock and took in fore topsail and outer jib at 10 sighted the old Cape. light tacked ship and headed to the Southard thick with fog and rain the wind hauling to to the Southard and breezing on

at 5 AM the wind South tacked and headed to the Eastward the wind increasing took in flying jib and main topsail. rain squalls. at 8 oclock set a bob jib and work of shore foggy At 4 PM hauled head to the westward and set both jibs very moderate and calm heavy sea running

The wind Easterly and foggy at 7 bells hove the lead in 12 fathoms water jibed the mainsail and head to the Southward Eastward at 12 oclock M and hauled down outer and flying jibs and hove to very moderate. at 4 set main topsail and flying jib headed S.S.W. at 6 P.M. hauled around headed to the Southward and Eastward the wind Southerly.
Calm at 2 Am. let go the small anchor in 10 fathoms water the wind breezed up Southerly in afternoon an old sea running dense fog. lay at anchor.

The wind Southerly and foggy and rainy in forenoon and cleared up in the afternoon with the wind to the North. got underway. Lancoty Head bore W. by S. about 12 miles distant. stood in by Point rip light and on the shoals at 10PM good breeze North by West. at 12 at night the wind hauling to the West.
The wind Westerly and moderate in the morning but increased to a fresh breeze beat into Vineyard Haven anchored at noon
The wind South W. got underway at 9 oclock on the turn of the tide and beat out through the Vineyard by the Light Ship abrest of the Beaver Tail light at 12 midnight

Calm in the morning anchored between the Beaver Tail light and Dutch Island at 4 am. Calm untill 9 oclock when the wind  breezed up S. S. W. got under way and went to Providence anchored at 4 P.M. Towed into the dock to discharge
The wind Easterly commenced  discharging took the deckload of down to the rails wrote letter home
The wind Easterly and rainy. work a little while and stoped on account of the rain
The wind North West finished deckload and let the hold full out by the Job
The wind Westerly laid at the wharf
The wind W. S. W. the crew loafing while the Lumber was being taken out
The wind Southerly and Westerly laying to the wharf having the Lumber taken out
The wind South West got unloaded at 8 oclock AM  took tugboat out from the wharf and towed in the River and made sail and beat down to Dutch Island and anchored at 9 p.m. Bound to New York
The wind South West laid at anchor in Duck Island Harbor work on vessel.

The wind South West in forenoon and hauled around to the North West. at night. Got under way at dark and went out moderate untill 12 oclock at night and the wind beginning to breeze up to the Eastward
The wind Easterly passed the Little Gull at 11:30 am Falkner's Island at 3 P.M. and and anchored Smith town bay 10 at p.m. thick with fog.
location: Little Gull Island Light, Falkner Island, Smithtown Bay

journal_entry: Calm in the morning At 7 oclock a very moderate wind to the North got underway at 8 oclock Calm. and at 12. the wind breezing up South West. beat up the Sound.

The wind South. W. abrest of Execution Rock at day light took tug boat at 7 A.M. and towed to New York anchored of the Batterry. Chartered to go to Rondout after coal for Boston Went to Weehawken and took the tow as sunset.
The wind Easterly heavy shower in afternoon arrived in Rondout at 2 oclock P.M. wrote letter home
The wind Westerly and very hot. got a berth to the wharf in forenoon and commenced loading at noon.
The wind N. W. finished loading at 9 Am and towed out in the River to take the tow down
The wind very moderate and baffling took the tow at day light. to go down river.
The wind S.S.W cast of from the tow at Weehawken at 7 oclock and took a tug boat and towed through the Gates passed Execution Rock at one p.m.
The wind South abrest of the Little Gull Light House at 8 oclock A.M. and stemed the tide in the race untill noon. and got by. Passed Holmes Hole at 10 PM and Cross rip light at 10 night raining
location: Little Gull Light, Vineyard Haven, Cross Rip Shoal

journal_entry: The wind S.S.W and foggy passed Pollock rip Light ship at 4am. at 8 1/2 Am the fog lighted and saw Nauset. anchored in Boston at 9 P.M. heavy rain storm with thunder and lightning.
The wind Westerly and very hot. towed into the berth to discharge very heavy thunder shower shower in the afternoon and evening.
The wind Easterly Commenced discharging coal
The wind Easterly finished onloading at noon and hauled of on flats ready to sail for home.
The wind S.S.E  got underway in Boston in the morning  passed Thatcher's Island at one PM Sighted Monheigan at 10 pm bearing North the wind hauling more Southerly.

The wind S.S.W abrest of Matinicus Rock Light at one A.m. passed duck Island at 8 Am foggy. run in Frenchman's Bay and have to 2 hours the fog scaled keped of and run in and anchored in Winter Harbor at 2 P.M. Settled with Capt Bickford and left the Schr Harp took my dunnage out.
location: Matinitcus Rock, Duck Island, Frenchman Bay, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and foggy.
The wind Southerly work in shop
The wind Southerly and foggy work in garden. wrote letters to James Chillcot and Secretary of Treasury D.C.
letter_to: James Chillcot, Secretary od Treasury D. C.

journal_entry: Calm in morning work jig sawing finish for Geo. W. Whitaker. The wind out Southerly and foggy in afternoon
The wind Southerly and foggy Work in Garden. wrote letters to Josiah Smallidge and Eunice Kingsley
The wind Southerly and foggy work in shop
The wind North West work in shop finished jib sawing for G. W. Whitaker
The wind North West went to Sabbath School in afternoon
The wind N.N.W. Commenced haying mowing in forenoon
The wind North West in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon mowed a little in morning polled in 8 stacks in afternoon recd letter from Mary A. Rosebrook
The wind Southerly poor hay day. work in shop
The wind Southerly and foggy. wrote letters to Mary Am. Rosebrook work in shop
The wind Easterly and foggy and rainy put down a mooring for a boat. and work in shop.
The wind N.N.W went lobstering in morning. and opened hay in the afternoon. went down on Turtle Island and got fish of Alvin Foss put up the hay at night. Recd letter from James Chilcott
location: Winter Harbor, Turtle Island, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind N. West. and pleasant went on Egg Rock to see the walls of the new Light house. polled in 6 stacks of hay in the after noon.
location: Winter Harbor, Egg Rock, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind S.S.E mowed in fore-noon and raked up in afternoon.
rainy the wind Southerly & Easterly work in shop. Making Crib
The wind Southerly and foggy. work in garden washed out fish and work in shop finished the Crib.
The wind Southerly mowed in forenoon hauled in 19 stacks of hay in afternoon
The wind Southerly hauled in 10 stacks of hay mowed in fore noon raked up in afternoon
The wind N. W. very fine day mowed in forenoon hauled in 15 stacks of hay in afternoon
The wind North West. hauled in 30 stacks of hay
The wind South. W. mowed in forenoon and raked up in afternoon.
The wind Easterly hauled in 25 stacks of hay. heavy rain in afternoon.
The wind Southerly and foggy and rainy work in shop.
The wind Southerly & foggy. rainy all day. Daniel McNeal arrested for breaking into G. W. Tracy's store.
The wind Southerly and foggy
The wind S. E. and foggy. at night a smart thunder shower work in shop all day.
NA
NA
The wind Southerly foggy in forenoon. went on Grind Stone Point Raspberrying
The wind Southerly and clear mowed in forenoon and raked up in afternoon finished mowing grass
The wind South East rainy work in shop
The wind Southerly and foggy Cutting wood at the door
The wind Southerly foggy in forenoon clear in afternoon cutting wood at the door.
The wind Northerly in morning and Southerly in afternoon hauled in 20 stacks of hay and finished haying
The wind Southerly and foggy work sawing wood
The wind Southerly and foggy went to Gouldsboro Point and staid all night
The wind Southerly and foggy got team and went to Milhage and back to marsh stoped to Clement Bunkers
The wind Southerly went home in the afternoon fogy
The wind Southerly and foggy went mackereling in forenoon went back to the marsh visiting with my wife
The wind Southerly and foggy visiting
The wind S.S.W. and foggy went home in the afternoon
The wind Northerly fine breeze. work for J. F. Kingsley haying all day wrote letter to C Stevens Esqr and Hancock Co pub Co.
letter_to: Chester Stevens, Hancock Co pub Co

journal_entry: The wind Southerly haying for J.F. Kingsley
The wind South work haying J.F. Kingsley
The wind N.W. in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon. Work all day haying J.F. Kingsley
The wind South and very hot work 1/4 day hewing sleepers for J. R. Hammond house
The wind S.W. Started for Ellsworth in the Schr Echo with J.R. Hammond after lumber for his house. anchored in Outer Bass Harbor at sun set.
The wind Southerly and very hot got under way at sun rise in Bass Harbor. and anchored at the mouth of Union River until the flood tide made then went past way up and laid until morn
The wind South started in the morning and got to Ellsworth at 9 oclock a.m. Commenced taking in lumber in the afternoon
The wind Northerly in morning & Southerly in afternoon. got the lumber on at noon to late for the tide to go down River
The wind Southerly towed down river about noon & made sail and beat down the bay. anchored at Moose Island in tremont. at dark thick with fog
The wind southerly very moderate and foggy. Fog lighted at noon got under way and went to Bass Harbor. thick again at night.
The wind Northerly and went aroung Southerly in after noon got home at night.
The wind S.S.E. windstorm and thick took the deck load of the Echo. work 1/4 day
Clear of very warm and pleasant. with the wind West fine breeze.
The wind Southerly and showery in fore noon. work all day taking out lumber and hauling it up.
The wind W.N.W. work one half day for T. R. Hammond. Turned pump box for Echo
The wind W.S.W. Started for Franklin in the Schr. Echo after lumber with F. R. Hammond got there in the afternoon and rafted the lumber at night and took it along side.
The wind North in morning took the lumber on board and went down as far as the Falls the wind South West in the afternoon.
The wind W.S.W in forenoon got underway and come down over the falls anchored the wind came of in the afternoon got underway and went home.
The wind N.N.W work one half day taking out lumber out of the Echo. Sawing wood for myself in afternoon.
The wind Southerly went Sunday School
The wind S.W. Went to to the Town House to State Elections
The wind Southerly Commenced work on T. R. Hammond's. house worked all day
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind South. W. work all day on T.R. Hammond's
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind North in morning and hauled around E.S. East and overcast. work all day for T.R. Hammonds
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind E.S.E. heavy breeze and big Storm work in shop all day jib sawing decoy &e
The wind W.N.W. very heavy blow Settled acct with G.W. Tracy and took up note of C Stevens work a part of the afternoon Sawing wood
Very moderate or calm all day went to Mrs. E.J. French. Religious lecture
The wind South West work all day on T.R. Hammonds House
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind Westerly work for Hammond laid under floors & boarding it in
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind Westerly work for Hammond put rafters on the main house and boarding the walks
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind N. W. work for Hammond
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind Westerly put rafters on the shed of T.R.H. and boarded it in
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: Calm in morning fresh breeze in afternoon S.S.W built stage around the house in the forenoon and commenced putting finished on in the after-noon. Work all day for T.R. Hammond
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and rainy in afternoon. The wind came of to the North at dark.
The wind Westerly good breeze work 1/4 day on house for T.R.H. the rem of the day splitting wood for my self.
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind Westerly work all day on T.R. Hammond house getting out window panes
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind South went to Prospect Harbor in the noon. work for T.R. Hammond. in afternoon.
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind South East. and rainy made pump box for A.G. Brooks and jobbing in shop.
The wind South and rainy by spells work all day on T.R.H. house. getting out finish
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind W.N.W. work all day on T.R. Hammonds house. putting on finish.
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind N.W. in forenoon & Southerly in afternoon. went to Sunday School.
The wind South work all day on T.R. Hammonds house.
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind South moderate and foggy work all day on T.R. Hammonds house and finish work.
local_place: Home, T. R Hammond's house, Home

journal_entry: The wind Easterly good breeze and clear. dug my potatoes and put wood in the shop.
The wind E.S.E. very fresh breeze and big rain-storm. Sylvanus Stovers Child Died
The wind N. West in morning and South West in the afternoon. Splitting wood at the door Alma Torrey Died at 2 p.m.
The wind N.E. Help make Casket for Alma Torrey
The wind N.E. rainy in afternoon
The wind South and rainy work in shop.
The wind North splitting wood recd letter from Capt E.H. Tracy
The wind Westerly went on Grind Stone point hunting foxes with hounds
The wind South Easterly Gathered turnips beets and carrots
The wind Easterly went to Milbridge with my dunnage to put on board the Bark Teekalet Shiped as Carpenter heavy rain at night
The wind Southerly went back home heavy rain at night. Recd letter from E H Tracy
The wind W.S.W very heavy breeze
The wind Southerly went back to Milbridge and commenced work on Board the Bark Teekalet. getting ready to sail for New York
The wind Easterly laid at the wharf working on vessel getting ready for sea bound to New York.

The wind Northerly Towed down River at 2 oclock a.m Made sail and went to sea. In the afternoon The wind W.S.W at dark took in fore & main royal. Main top galliant stasail flying & out jibs wind breezing hauling to the west
location: Winter Harbor??? Wa on thw way to NYC

journal_entry: The wind W.N.W. Took in fore & main galliant sails and reefed both topsails. fresh breeze

North West very moderate shook reefes out top sails and set all sail the wind hauling to the Easterly at noon Lat. 40.26 at night the wind hauled S.W. tacked ship and stood of shore. very moderate all night
The wind Southerly Tacked ship and headed to the West very pleasant all day at 8 oclock pm tack ship and headed to the South at 12 night tacked and head to the West.
very moderate all day overcast and in the afternoon foggy sounded in 10 fathoms water. wind variable took in light sails and headed of shore

The wind Westerly fog scaled set all sail. and headed in shore. work in Carpenter shop at night took in royals. top galliant sails outer jib and settled down topsails wind hauling Northerly and blowing fresh

The wind North Easterly and hauling East. set all sail sighted land bering N.W. at night the wind S. E. took all light sails in. Took a pilot at  9 p.m. blowing fresh at 12 at night. took a very heavy squall with rain to the west and anchored in side the Hook.
wind_speed_night: blowing fresh, very heavy squall, rain

journal_entry: The wind S.W. got under way in the morning and anchored in New York at 10 am furled up sails and cleaned up decks
The wind S.W. towed in to the dock in Brooklyn wrote letter home.
The wind Easterly and very warm wrote letter home went up town & bought a lot of Carpenters tools
The wind Easterly and in the after-noon rainy work fixing up shop
The wind West and cold Went to Plymouth Church Preaching by H.W. Beecker wrote letters home and J.F. Kingsley & A Smallidge
The wind Westerly work in shop all day Recd letter from Capt Freeman Tracy
The wind West Cleared up the hold getting ready to take ballast
The wind Westerly Stevedores Took out ballast wrote letter to Freeman Tracy
The wind N.E. rainy in afternoon Towed over to Jersey City
Northerly Winds and cold. Commenced loading with tobacco for Leghorn wrote letter home and one to C. Y. Bunker.
The wind West Stevedores loading Bark with tobacco Recd letter from home.
very moderate. and pleasant all day. The wind Southerly. wrote letter home
The wind North making chocks for water Casks Stevedores loading
The wind Northerly work in shop Stevedores loading
The wind South East and rainy all day. wrote letter home
The wind Northerly fresh breeze and pleasant.
The wind Westerly work in shop making Hatch Coming
very moderate all day wind South West. finished Coming No cargo recd Recd letter from home.
The wind N. E. had pictures taken at No 1 Chambers St New York wrote letter home
The wind N.N.E and over cast jobbing in shop went to Theatre  in Jersey City
The wind Easterly and rainy all day Signed articles on board the Bark Teekalet to go to Leghorn recd on advance $25. sent check of $25  home on Miller & Houghton. wrote two letters home
The wind N.W. heavy blow Recd letter from C.Y. Bunker
The wind Southerly recieved cargo work on vessel.
The wind Southerly no cargo recd
The wind Westerly Finished loading the vessel in the morning recd letter from home
The wind Easterly and rainy wrote letter home
The wind Southerly work all day getting ready for sea crew on board At night towed from the wharf down by Governers Island and anchored.
The wind Easterly and rainy. laid at anchor all day sent down fore and main royal yards

The wind North West. moderate in morning Pilot on board Took tug boat and towed to sea Bound to Leghorn set all sail. the wind increasing secured every thing about decks unbent anchors stowed chains and cleaned up decks. at night the wind blowing fresh fresh to the N.W.
The wind North West fresh breeze the wind hauled around N.E. The day begins at midnight. and ends at midnight. as Civil time

At 4 am the wind S.E. at 7 bells tacked ship and headed to the East saw a bank heading to the Southward at 4 pm took in top gallant sails and reefed topsails Saw a bank heading W. at 11 took in fore & main topsails wind increasing hauling S.W.

The wind South West at 2 am hauled up mainsail and furled it and reefed spanker blowing heavy at day light rainy wind hauling aft. set upper main topsail saw a bank heading to the Southward At 8 p.m. the wind came of to the Northward heavy rain squalls run under town topsails and fousail heavy sea running
The wind North set reefed spanker and jib and gaftTopsail the wind hauled around Easterly at 8 pm took in all gaft topsail and flying jib. moderate winds and heavy sea
The wind South West set all sail the wind increasing Course E.S.E at 6 PM run under lower topsails and foresail very rough and overcast
The wind Westerly. moderate gale heavy rain and big sea running at 4 p.m. more moderate sea main Top gallant sail over reef Topsail.
The wind North West heavy rain squalls at noon shook reef out main Topsail.
The wind North West heavy winds Course E.S.E. rain squalls at 7 p.m. a very heavy squall to the west. took in all sail except tower Topsails and run before the wind at 8 pm set foresail.
The wind N.N.W. heavy breeze. at noon set reefed fore and main top sails big sea running at 6 pm took in upper fore S main topsails and run under lower topsails and foresail  heavy squalls with rain

The wind N.N.W. very smart breeze at 2 am took in foresail and run under lower topsail at 8 am more moderate set foresail upper main topsail and reefed foretopsail  and top gallant sail. at 4 pm squally took in top gallant sail and upper topsail at 8 pm moderate wind with heavy sea set main topsail main top gallant fore top sail reefed

The wind W.N.W. very moderate and pleasant. at 6 am shook reef out foretopsail and set fore top gallant sail. clear  weather and good observations. at noon set all sail. at dark took in outer jib fore and main top gallant sails and reefed fore and main topsails. at 9 oclock in the evening took in every thing beet lower topsails heavy rain squalls with thunder and lightning. wind hauling around W.S.W.

The wind W.S.W. heavy storm with thunder and lightning at 5 am wind and rain ceased. set foresail jib mizzen staysail main topmast staysail reefed main topsail reefed fore topsail top gallant sails over reefed topsails at 4 pm squally took in both top gallant sails. at 8 clear weather set both top gallant sails.
The wind S.S.W. moderate in the morning made sail. at noon the wind breezing at night was under reefed spanker. lower topsails foresail & fore topmast stays sail. fresh breeze.
The wind S.S.W. very fresh breeze at 8 am hauled up foresail. at night the wind very moderate N.N.W. set topsails and main top gallant sail.
The wind variable and very moderate set all sail except main topmast & mizzen staysails afternoon showery.
The wind W.S.W. rainy in morning North West at night

The wind variable and very pleasant all day set all sail. In the morning sighted the Island of St. Mary. one of the Azores or Western Islands. remained in sight all day. at midnight overcast the wind breezing S.S. West
location: Island of St. Mary, Azores/Western Islands

journal_entry: The wind S.S.W. breezing on in the morning took in all the light sails At noon took in both top gallant sails At one oclock reefed both topsails and spanker. after noon rainy furled mainsail
The wind North West pleasant but good breeze set main top gallant sail saw several vessels bount to the Westward
The wind S.S.E. took in main top gallant sail good breeze reefed fore and main topsails saw a large steamer and several vessels.
The wind very moderate.set all sail. at night the wind breezed up to the Westward. rain squalls. at midnight took in gaft topsail and spanker.
The wind Northerly and pleasant. set all sail Saw a steamer bound to the west.
The wind North West. very smooth and pleasant saw a number of vessels. at 4 oclock p.m. shackeled chain on Starboard bow anchor
Very moderate in morning at 4 am saw lights on Cape Spartel Africa at day light saw the land. abrest of the rock Gibraltar becabaned in the afternoon
The wind Easterly tacked ship at 8 bells in the morning and stood to the Southward. at noon tacked to N. Eastward rainy at night. got through the Straits of Gibraltar into the Meditarranean Sea
The wind Easterly and drizzling rain in morning clear in afternoon beat to windward all day tacking every 4 and 8 hours
The wind Easterly and clear weather beating to windward the whole 24 hours in the Mediterranean sea.
The wind Easterly moderate & pleasant In the med. sea Lat at noon 36,00 Long 3.55.W. beating to windward all day.
The wind Easterly overcast sun obscure. Beating to windward following up the coast of Spain
The wind Easterly good weather fine breeze. beating to windward on the coast of Spain in the mediterranean.
The wind Easterly and overcast apart of the day rainy took in all the Light sails
The wind Easterly smart breeze and heavy rain took in upper fore and main topsails at night moderate set topsails.
The wind Easterly and pleasant. set all sail
The wind Easterly fresh breeze took a squall at 8 oclock p.m. took in all light sails fresh breeze until mid night
The wind Easterly and pleasant set all the light sails. from dark untill ten oclock calm when the wind breezed up very moderate to the westward
The wind Westerly and very pleasant Longitude 12 miles East at noon. At dark calm.
The wind Easterly in morning and in the afternoon Westerly. In the Mediterranean Sea bound for Leghorn Italy. In Bark Teerkalet of New York loaded with tobacco
